questions.question: The workers had a long talk with the manager, ………………………… why they didn’t want to work on Saturdays.
questions.description: Here ‘the workers’ is the subject of explaining. The adverbial participle clause is possible when it has the same subject as the main clause.

questions.question: ……………………………. out of the window, I could see a lovely range of mountains.
questions.description: Here also both clauses have the same subject.

questions.question: She had a ………………………….. expression on her face.
questions.description: A concerned expression is a worried expression. The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: His explanation made me more ……………………………….
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: He is an ……………………………. writer.
questions.description: The present participle is used to describe the people or things that cause the feelings. Here the writer is the person who creates the feeling of interest.

questions.question: The children get terribly ………………………….whenever we have guests.
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: It was an ……………………………. prospect.
questions.description: The present participle is used to describe the people or things that cause the feelings.

questions.question: I couldn’t enjoy the party because I was ……………………………..
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: He lived alone, ……………………………. by everybody.
questions.description: He had been forgotten by everybody. The past participle has a passive meaning when it is used like an adjective or adverb.

questions.question: She ran out of the room …………………………..
questions.description: She was screaming. The present participle has an active meaning when it is used like an adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He is still nursing a …………………………….. heart.
questions.description: A broken heart is a heart that has been broken.

questions.question: The people ………………………………. gave very different opinions.
questions.description: The people questioned are people who have been questioned. The past participle has a passive meaning.
